intro: Petasites farfara, commonly known as the meadow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with many petals. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has a short, stout stem with heart-shaped leaves. Its roots are rhizomatous, allowing it to spread vegetatively, and it is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Petasites farfara is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in early summer.
